reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel because I was looking for a romantic hotel with a jacuzzi. We booked the Elm Suite, which was one of the more expensive rooms. The hotel was really lovely and the jacuzzi divine. Breakfast was quite a small selection and brought to us upon order. The hotel is also not walking distance from anything so you would need a car to go anywhere.
reviews.title: Lovely Romantic Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: from the minute we arrived the service was superb - the quality of staff and food here is as a much more expensive hotel - the food was so good and portions ample - so we only had dinner on the first and last night or would have had more to walk off! We were on our honeymoon and were upgraded from the second night once a bigger room was available (four posters with a very high bed -felt like a princess!) - and given bubbly on arrival - the grounds and hotel are wonderful - ideal location for couples -(and blissfully free of young children/families im gald to report) peaceful and relaxing - the rooms are old fashioned and quant which is perfect for the location - the toiletries are lovely and you have as much to use as you need - very special staff and management - thank you! Will def be back
reviews.title: What a hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the weekend was a surprise present from family for my birthday.it was a lovely place,very traditional and very clean. and not too far from the lakes.we really only used the hotel to sleep in and have breakfast before exploring the lake district.the room was very comfortable but I would have liked a proper shower and not just a hook on the wall.when we came back on saturday night I took a glass of white wine to my room .no choice of wine and definitely not cold .I also asked for some milk and coffee for the bedroom,was told it had been replenished earlier but it hadn't been. was pleasantly surprised to find the bed turned down but also surprised that the bedroom door was unlocked.at breakfast we had to ask for another pot of coffee,didn't bother the second morning as I think they should have asked us first.on monday morning packing to leave I discovered a lipstick missing.I looked everywhere in the room.I had used it on sunday and left it in the hotel.its only a lipstick I know but its annoying.sorry if this all sounds so negative but maybe it could benifit other guests if the owners are made aware.
reviews.title: quiet weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful. The grounds are gorgeous, the hotel is devine, the greeting at reception was welcoming and professional, the room was pleasant, but the mattress was poor. The mattress in the Maple Room was the worst mattress we have ever slept on in all the hotels that we have stayed at. We both had an uncomfortable night and I woke up a few times feeling aches and pains. You can run your hand along the mattress and feel the springs protruding outwards so to lie on it for several hours was not the greatest. We were also disapointed by the service at breakfast. The staff at breakfast were fine in that they were not rude but they were not hospital either and the breakfast definatley was not worth £10.00 each - please note we prefer to pay more for food knowing that it will be good. On checking out we were not asked how our stay was but once we had paid and we were about to leave I turned back to let the person know, quite politely, that the mattress was very uncomforatable of which she replied "Right!" and then stood in silence with nothing more to add. So we walked away feeling a definative disapointment with Broadoaks there after.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and grounds - poor customer service!

likes.disliked: — No internet (the wireless sygnal wasn't strong enough to reach our room) /The service/The mattress
